abstracts.cdata!:
The Project will improve services to the
            urban poor, by supporting community organizations in voicing
            their needs, and sharing in public decision making, while
            making local governments more responsive to the needs of the
            poor, through increased cooperation with community
            organizations, through the provision of funds to community
            based organizations and local governments, for the provision
            of services to the urban poor. Subproject proposals shall
            minimize land, and asset acquisition (as well as involuntary
            displacement), through a participatory process. Displace
            persons will be assisted in improving their livelihoods, and
            standards of living, or at least restore them to pre-project
            implementation levels. Loss of land in urban areas will be
            replaced at market values of land of equal size and use,
            with similar or improved public infrastructure facilities
            and services, plus the cost of any registration an/or
            transfer fees. Loss of agricultural land will likewise be
            replaced at market value of land of equal productive
            potential or use, located in the vicinity of the affected
            land, plus the cost of land preparation to levels similar to
            those of lost land, plus the cost of registration and
            transfer taxes. Housing and other structure losses, shall be
            compensated at market costs of materials for either total,
            or partial replacement of affected structure, plus any costs
            such as labor, contractor's fees, etc. Other assistance
            includes assistance for income restoration, in the form of
            training as needed; to start or develop small businesses;
            access to credit, and, moving assistance during the
            transition period.
